method.text: Whisk together the egg yolks and honey until thick, pale and creamy. Heat the single cream in a pan until almost boiling. Slowly pour onto the egg mixture, stirring constantly.

Strain the custard through a sieve back into the pan then cook over a gentle heat stirring constantly for 5-8 min or until slightly thickened. DO NOT BOIL OR IT WILL CURDLE. Pour the custard into a clean bowl and leave to cool.

Lightly whip 300 ml double cream and fold into the custard with the vanilla essence. Mash the bananas with the lemon juice in a bowl, then stir into the cooled custard mixture. Pour into a shallow freezerproof container, cover and freeze until mushy. This will take approximately 2 hours.

Turn the ice cream into a chilled bowl and mash with a fork to break up any ice crystals. Melt the chopped plain chocolate with the remaining double cream (75 ml/ 3 floz) in a heatproof bowl over a pan of simmering water and leave to cool. Stir the pecan nuts into the softened ice cream. Dot the cooled melted chocolate mixture over the top of the ice cream and stir in very gently to give the rippled effect. Refreeze until solid.
Allow the ice cream to soften slightly at room temperature before serving.
